file_content.text: I'm a city girl, but there's something about this place that rubs me wrong.
So much has changed since I was last on this world. This bastion of the Sith is glorious.
Kaas City, all shiny and new. Makes you want to burn the whole thing down.
Wow, that must be the Citadel! That's the center of the universe as far as the Empire's concerned... how big do you think those flags are?
This road is rough in the dark. I keep stumbling.
Why do the Sith bury their dead, if only to dig them back up again?
They dug up something down here. I don't get it, though--you bury history for a reason.
Nar Shaddaa was nothing like this, there's nothing to be sentimental about there. If something's old and unused, it gets knocked down and built over, usually with a casino.
Just when you thought there weren't enough big statues on this planet.
A Sith who cannot finish a statue does not deserve a statue.
There's, what, a couple thousand slaves here? If they had any brass, they wouldn't have waited 'til the statue was half-built to start shooting. They deserve what they get.
Would you look at the size of that statue... there must have been an army of slaves building it. No wonder the Imperials haven't stamped out the rebellion yet.
Good thing I'm not afraid of heights. Or invading a hostile Sith compound, for that matter.
Hiding behind walls. Cowardly.
Every time we get near a checkpoint, I expect someone to start shooting. Planetary security... just try to frisk me.
Grathan's estate should be just over this bridge. We don't want to get trapped there. Everything I've dug up about Grathan is seriously disturbing, even for a Sith.
Sith sure do love their monuments. If they're trying to impart a sense of doom, you can tell them... uh... mission accomplished.
Dark energies here. A good place for a feast.
People have nightmares about this sort of stuff, and you make a whole planet out of it. How can you live here?
Hey, uh, I know I might be a little late mentioning this, but I'm getting some seriously creepy signals out here. I really don't think we should go in there.
Welcome to Dromund Kaas, where freedom goes to die, and legends are forced on the galaxy.
Dromund Kaas, land of glorious shadow.
Nice jungle. You people've got a freaky world; they ready for us?
Sheesh, it's so dark. Let's see what time it is here...? Oh, apparently it's always this gloomy. Lovely.
Wow, nice lights--walk in here, you get an instant headache.
This will be ruin some day, too.
They're scared of you here, aren't they? You come, you go... you're the freaking secret police.
That's very... patriotic. Do you get the feeling that we're really out of place here?
Did I ever mention I have a fear of being crushed by falling rock?
None of these pathetic Sith compare to Tulak Hord.
On Rattatak, place like this could be ten years old. Big stuff doesn't last long on Rattatak.
These monoliths have seen better days. I wonder what it used to be. Then again, I probably don't want to know the answer.
That's a pretty big wall--must really want to keep out the riffraff.
What do the Sith fear that they build so many walls? They should be out conquering, not hiding.
Look at this. No one's ever come close to your planet, but you look like you're about to fight a war.
Considering that the Empire rules every corner of this planet, and the amount of nasty wildlife I've seen so far, I'm not sure I want to know what a wall that size is keeping out.
Somebody misplace some giant slabs of rock?
Old glories. Forgotten Sith. Leave them be.
We loot a place like this, sell the antiques on the black market... who'd have to know?
Have you noticed all these carvings? Who'd have thought the Sith were so big on statues?
Man, I could make a fortune in here. You think maybe I can just take a little... no? Okay, okay.
This place reeks of death.
Did you say something? Swear there's someone talking to me....
I can still hear them talking... I cut off my holoreceiver, but I can still hear them. If I lose it, please don't leave me down here.
Kaas City makes me feel tiny. I don't suppose you share in that sentiment.
These Sith build and build when they should be conquering.
Like the city isn't big enough. This some Sith project, or you just need space for a few million slaves?
It's kind of funny, seeing so much of the new Kaas City growing up around the old Sith architecture. It's like stepping through time.
Towers ought to be towering. I approve.
These towers do not compare to the monuments of old.
Slow down. We can spread out, have a picnic, watch the lightning.
Hate to be the maintenance guy for that. Can you imagine having to trudge out here every time a vine cat climbs the signal tower?
I know what you're thinking--nice place for a slaughter, right?
The Sith do battle over this?
Hope you don't mind taking down your own people. If you do, I can handle it myself....
You know, this place might have been pretty once. I wonder what it was like before the Sith.
One day, I want a statue erected of me. Don't even pretend I'm alone on that one.
What is the point of such monuments?
So, all those people--you know they're crazy, right? Trust me, I've seen enough cults in my day.
Is that supposed to be the Emperor? He looks kind of cozy, but why build a monument all the way out here?
Is that Revan? Impressive secret shrine thingy.
A forgotten Sith Lord with a collection of devout followers. Still, who even remembers the deeds of Tulak Hord?
I don't like this place, I don't like being here. Do what you have to with the statue and let's get out.
That's Revan... I heard he took that mask from a Mandalorian before he started his crusade to drive them out of the galaxy.
Yeah, I had a room like this growing up back home. No big deal.
This place makes me uncomfortable.
More machines, more droids. Didn't know Sith were such tech freaks.
Oh, I bet there are a lot of dirty secrets kept here. No telling how long it'd take to try and slice these systems, though.
Market value of this place must be sky-high. Makes my brain hurt trying to figure.
I've not seen such a collection since Tulak Hord.
Old pirate story about a guy who steals a Sith relic. Skin turns black, disease eats him up--but if you want to grab what's in here, I'm up for it.
I wouldn't touch anything if I were you; there's no telling what security Grathan has on this stuff... or how dangerous they are without them.
Wouldn't mind a little refreshment. You know, if we're going to be here a while.
Why do we waste our time in this place?
Knew a guy who went to a Sith party, once. He was the "entertainment," came back... wrong. Had to put him down; this place is messed up.
Well, this place looks lively. I guess the Imperials have something that passes for fun after all.
I'm hearing ominous theme music in my head. Kinda catchy.
The guts of the great city.
No one sleeping on the streets, no dark alleys where the rich folk get scared... this isn't a city. It's a prison.
If you think this place is big, you should see Nar Shaddaa. Buildings as far as the eye can see, and alleys you can get lost in forever.
